availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac O. Adkins (Butler County, Kentucky, farmer and Justice of the Peace)

body.p: Butler County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Mary R. Moore Adkins. Father of William Adkins, Nancy Adkins, Sarah J. Adkins, James W. Adkins, Robert A. Adkins, Almeda C. Adkins, John W. Adkins, Joseph H. Adkins, Virgil C. Adkins, Francis C. Adkins, and Agnes Adkins. Farmer in Butler County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Butler County in 1860. Justice of the peace for District 3 in Butler County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Butler County, p. 278A.
